HPI 8370 Nissan Skyline GT-R (R34) V-Spec (Sonic Silver)



The R34 GT-R was introduced in 1999 and there were no fewer than 11 variations. The V-Spec (or Victory Specification) was the next step up from a ‘standard’ GT-R and included additional aero parts, brake ventilation ducts, diffuser, and an active limited slip differential. According to the GT-R registry, 514 V-Specs were produced in Sonic Silver. At the time you could have your own for ¥5,598,000 (or a little over $48,000). That is about $72,000 today based on inflation, which is about the starting price for a Tesla Model S. I’ll take the R-34 GT-R…

Here is HPI’s version of a Sonic SIlver V-Spec with optional oil cooler (part #5UBWH). The asymmetrical front bumper has been reproduced nicely to reflect this.
